questions.question: What happens when advice is given?

questions.question: Why does the speaker request listening instead of advice? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: Because advice interrupts feelings and blocks expression.

questions.question: What happens when someone feels misunderstood? (Variant 52)
questions.answer: They feel lonely or ignored even when someone is present.

questions.question: How does listening help the speaker? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: It allows emotions to clear and thoughts to settle.

questions.question: Why does the poet reject quick solutions? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: Because problems are solved slowly by the thinker.

questions.question: What is the difference between hearing and listening? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: Hearing uses ears; listening uses understanding and attention.

questions.question: Why does the poet compare the listener to God? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: Because God hears without interrupting or judging.

questions.question: Why does advice sometimes frustrate people? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: Because it suggests the listener is not truly paying attention.

questions.question: What does the poem say about inner answers? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: Solutions often already exist inside the speaker.

questions.question: Why does the speaker want to talk aloud? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: Talking helps organise thoughts and find meaning.

questions.question: How can silence be supportive? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: It gives space for thought and respect without pressure.

questions.question: Explain why the poet insists on listening rather than giving advice. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: Listening lets a person share feelings openly without interruption or judgement, helping them heal on their own.

questions.question: Discuss how the poem shows the power of empathy. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: Empathy is shown when someone simply stays, listens and respects emotions instead of trying to control them.

questions.question: Why does the poet compare listening to a prayer to God? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: Because prayer is silent and trusting; God hears without correcting or interrupting, which is what speakers need from people too.

questions.question: How does expressing feelings aloud help a troubled person? (Insight 154)
questions.answer: Speaking openly allows confusion to fade and new understanding to develop, turning pain into insight.

questions.question: Describe the message of the poem in your own words. (Insight 155)
questions.answer: The poem teaches us to support others by listening, trusting and caring rather than solving everything for them.
